answer:
The routine BC infant immunization schedule is posted here. To receive all four recommended two month vaccines, the earliest is eight weeks of age. The minimum (youngest) age for vaccines vary by product:

		Pneumococcal conjugate-13: 8 weeks

		Rotavirus: 6 weeks

		Hexavalent (DTap-HB-IPV-Hib): 6 weeks

		Meningococcal-C-conjugate:  8 weeks
Immunization Nurse

6 weeks

question: Do I need to wait exactly 2 months (60 days) to have my kids vaccinated for the first time or 8 weeks is considered enough time?
question_variation_0: how long does it take for your kid to be vaccinated
